Cyber Risk Associates provides enterprise-quality security and privacy programs scaled to small professional practices, tailored to the individual client.  We believe HIPAA compliance is just the foundation for developing a culture that protects your patients, your practice, and your family.   We know that securing the practice begins with securing the individual -- as experience in community-level cyber preparedness shows. Through blended training, combining presentation with active, practical participation, risk management becomes second nature.  2017 HIPAA Audits by OCR and HHS are coming.  We can help you meet all HIPAA requirements in security, privacy, training, EHR meaningful use, breach response, analysis, resolution and mandatory risk assessment.  You have better things to focus on!  Call us for a courtesy review of your Notice of Privacy Practices, we're just down the street and would be delighted to visit.

Travis D.
Deputy Chief Privacy and Compliance Officer
November 30, 2016, David worked with Travis but at different companies

Privacy requires a deep understanding, not only of the regulations with which people and organizations must comply but even more, understanding the people themselves, and how individuals deal with the responsibilities of interpreting and applying rules and regulations.  Travis recognizes this, and operates with that depth of understanding.  He knows that while a "firewall" is the hallmark of security, a "people-wall" is the protector of privacy, and that compliance is an active verb, not a passive adjective.

Rich Morris
VP HR at SPCA of Texas
January 29, 2009, Rich was senior to David but didn’t manage directly

Richard Morris developed an environment of business-appropriate policies and practices that upgraded our processes and accountability to a much higher standard than typical for a non-profit organization.  It is frequent in non-profits to hear, "Why can't it be run more like a business?"  At the SPCA, with the leadership of James Bias and Rich Morris, we attained, and exceeded that goal.  In addition to the HR side of the organization, Rich also inspired a greater understanding of how Kaizen/Six Sigma improvement analysis could help everyone reach a higher quality of operations.

summary: Bringing Information Privacy and Security to small business and nonprofits in a low-cost service is a driving passion.  Threats to privacy increase daily, and protecting oneself, one's business and family is a critical imperative.  Healthcare is particularly vulnerable and a special focus of concern.  So is PCI-DSS, standards for credit card security.  David is Certified in US Privacy Regulation (CIPP/US) and HIPAA Compliance (CHP).  He combines dynamic writing and presentation skills with enhanced, participatory training, to develop situational awareness of the very real threats among staff members.  His company, Cyber Risk Associates, provides enterprise quality compliance programs for SMBs, healthcare providers and business associates, performing risk analyses, gap remediation and maintaining documentation required by regulation.  David writes on Privacy and Security for a variety of publications, including San Antonio Medicine Magazine, the San Antonio Express News; and has appeared on radio and television, helping the audience understand the threats and respond to them more fully.
name: David Schulz, CIPP CHP
title: Executive Director & CEO of Cyber Risk Associates
